Title: Antonomasia
References: ŠTULAJTEROVÁ, A., JESENSKÁ, P.: English Stylistics. 1. vyd. Banská Bystrica : Univerzita Mateja Bela, 2013. 114 s.
Content:
Antonomasia is intended to point out the leading, most characteristic feature of a person or event in the form of a proper name.

It is mostly realised in the written language, because capital letters are the only signals to denote the presence of this stylistic device.

examples:

  • the Iron Lady
  • Your Majesty
  • the Bard of Avon
